meanings.definition: A tax or land rental paid by a freeholder in lieu of services.
meanings.sent1: The quitrent was a fee the landowner paid instead of doing work on the land.
meanings.sent2: The quitrent was due at the beginning of each month for the use of the property.
meanings.sent3: The quitrent was like a small gift to the landlord for letting them live on the land.
meanings.sent4: Paying the quitrent was like giving a little thank you to the landowner for the land.
meanings.sent5: The quitrent was a small price to pay for the privilege of living on such beautiful land.

meanings.definition: A fixed rent paid by a tenant in lieu of services.
meanings.sent1: The tenant paid the quitrent every month to the landlord for the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The quitrent was set at a reasonable amount for the tenant to afford.
meanings.sent3: The quitrent felt like a fair trade for the tenant to have a place to live.
meanings.sent4: Paying the quitrent was like securing a safe haven for the tenant.
meanings.sent5: The quitrent ensured the tenant had a roof over their head without extra chores.
